name: Holiday Inn Little Rock-Presidential-Dwntn

reviews.text: I had a very pleasant 3 day stay. Everything was up to Holiday inn standards. Only complaint the old tv's need to be replaced. free high speed internet a plus!.
reviews.title: LITTLE ROCK TRIP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Little Rock after visiting the Bill Clinton Presidential Library, which it was very convenient to (right on the other side of I-30). We were able to walk to the downtown area (maybe a mile or so) for dinner. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was very clean. We had free breakfast at Camp David, which was buffet but not that great. Wireless internet is free, but was really slow when I tried to use it. Still, a solid, comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Overall, a good stay

reviews.text: The hotel was awesome. All the staff was polite and friendly and were more than accommodating. When my laptop was not working, and all the computers were taken in the business center, one of the staff members took the time to look up and print out directions for me.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Exceptional Staff

reviews.text: The room was great! It was large, clean, and up-to-date. The bed was SO comfortable. The bathroom was stocked with lots of towels and soaps and it was super clean!
reviews.title: Nice property, but do not count on the shuttle

reviews.text: I was staying here during RiverFest and the hotel shuttle picked up and dropped off me and my friends everytime we asked.
reviews.title: Great Food

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on 2 seperate occasions during our holiday. The staff very friendly and helpful. Lots to look at inside the very large lobby area,of Presidents gifts etc.Camp David restaurant inside this Hotel serves wonderful food and service good. Next to this is a smallish bar area and they have Happy hr from 4pm to 6pm? as well. The beds were very comfortable, with a choice of firmness pillows. Free internet service just off the reception. We used the hotel shuttle for visiting President Clintons Library and also from the airport. This would make a very nice first overnight stop, as i read if Restaurant closed when you arrive they do serve some hot food. Hotel sparkled.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because it was close to the business I was working with for the week. Before making my final selection, I spoke with a few locals and received mixed reviews. Half of those polled state it was ok and the other half said maybe. Overall, everyone agreed that it would be acceptable for the purpose of which I would be there. As a result of the reviews I chose a premium room in hopes of offsetting the disappointment I anticipated.
reviews.title: So much more than I expected

reviews.text: Needless to say, the upgrade was not necessary. The lobby was bright and inviting, the presidential memorabilia was engrossing and museum-like and the staff was far friendlier than I had encountered in a long time.
reviews.title: Ants, heat, and flat pillows...OH MY!!!

reviews.text: The restaurant Camp David was so well designed that every seat was a good seat and the bar staff and atmosphere made me feel as if I were at the local watering hole with familiar faces. More importantly, the food was great. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are all given the same first-class attention and the patrons are very attentive.
reviews.title: Okay. Rooms In Need Of A Refurb

reviews.text: Overall this hotel proved to be more than a “good night’s sleep”. Its welcoming staff and cheerful environment makes you feel pretty good about being away from home.
reviews.title: Simple but takes care of my needs
Look Elsewhere
reviews.text: Echo other reviews - freeway noise unbelievable, hard bed, lumpy pillows. Cleaning staff turned the heat off leaving the room cool and damp when returned at the end of the day. The "Please flush frequently" sign on the back of the bathroom door - thought that was a joke in one of the reviews until I saw it (I had no problem; one of my coworkers had a toilet that wouldn't stop running until the water was shut off). VERY disorganized service at breakfast - have said that, their oatmeal was some of the best I've had in a restaurant; highly recommended. Did not feel comfortable venturing out for a walk. Another coworker went for a run and was approached by several unsavory individuals. Desk staff ran hot and cold - sometimes they were helpful, other times brusk.
Arrived late at night, shuttle picked me up, which was fabulous.Stayed for 2 nights then returned two days later. This hotel has a shuttle service to airport and downtown which is fabulous!
reviews.title: great location..facility lacking

reviews.text: Check in was OK...room was slightly undersize for the cost, but be warned: The walls are paper thin...room sounds travel through them quite well.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel, mostly great but be warned...

reviews.text: First night, noticed the toilet did not flush...called front desk next morning to report. Also mentioned it to desk clerk when leaving for meetings. Upon return late afternoon, toilet still clogged. Walked down to desk and the front desk manager took ownership of the problem and got it fixed ASAP. Great service from him, he handled very well!
reviews.title: Service above and beyond

reviews.text: After being gone for two days, and returning for last night in Little Rock, different room..different floor....no toilet problems, but thin wall problem was still evident..TV sounds and neighbor's room "sounds" were easily heard.
reviews.title: Attention To Detail = A Good Lodging Experience

reviews.text: I remember 30 years ago when Holiday Inns were something special; well this one is just that, a special Holiday Inn of 30 years ago. Nothing "Presidential" about this Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Not even "Senatorial"

reviews.text: The good: decent bed, nice pillows, good water pressure, no outside noise and little room-to-room noise; generally nice people.
reviews.title: Average Rooms/No Food Nearby

reviews.text: The not-so-good: slow check in (not even sure if rooms were ready and it was 6 pm); tiny bathroom with bad lighting and no ventilation; cheap linens; old fashioned TV which is too small for the room and poorly located; erratic internet connections which sometimes work, sometimes slow down, and sometime disappear, all in the middle of a session; loud doors; over-priced breakfast; nothing--and I do mean nothing--within a two block walk. And steer clear of the "seafood buffet" unless your definition of "seafood" includes the words "deep fried."
reviews.title: Talk about pretentious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Priceline and received this hotel. It was a nice hotel but if you were just stopping in for one night, it was nothing special.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Staff, and Great Drinks!

reviews.text: We had to drive several miles away to find a restaurant for the family.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place, Close to the heart of the city!!

aka: Holiday Inn Little Rock-Presidential-Dwntn Hotel Little Rock
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Presidential in Downtown Little Rock. We’re a locally owned and operated, full service hotel offering 150 guest rooms, including 11 Executive and Presidential Suites. We professionally serve the business traveler or we’re perfect for that special weekend getaway. With over 4,000 square feet of meeting space, the Holiday Inn Presidential can accommodate all of your corporate or private events. Our hotel is conveniently located off 6th Street and I-30 in eclectic Downtown Little Rock. Our complimentary shuttle service can provide transportation to and from the airport, as well as to the many downtown attractions such as the Clinton Presidential Library, the River Market District, our Convention Centers or the State Capitol. We invite you to relax in our magnificent lobby while viewing our “award winning” White House and Presidential Memorabilia. Please consider our invitation to serve you at the Holiday Inn Presidential. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!
